item.title: 中国芯片制造商和云服务提供商争相采用国产 DeepSeek
item.description: 中国企业，从芯片制造商到云服务提供商，都争先恐后地支持 DeepSeek 的人工智能模型，这让分析师们欢呼这是行业的 "分水岭时刻"。【原文：Chinese companies, from chip makers to cloud service providers, are rushing to support DeepSeek's artificial intelligence models, spurring analysts to hail a "watershed moment" for the industry.】

item.title: 诺和诺德第四季度利润超预期，预计 2025 年增长放缓
item.description: 伟哥生产商诺和诺德（Novo Nordisk）周三预测，2025年的销售增长速度将低于2024年，这可能会加深投资者对该公司在竞争激烈的肥胖症市场上被竞争对手礼来（Eli Lilly）甩开的担忧。【原文：Wegovy maker Novo Nordisk on Wednesday forecast slower sales growth for 2025 than 2024, a blow that is likely to deepen investor concerns that the company is losing its edge in the competitive obesity market to rival Eli Lilly .】

item.title: 消息人士称，中国已推迟或改变了 60 万吨小麦的进口方向
item.description: 两位直接了解此事的贸易消息人士称，中国已推迟进口多达 60 万公吨的小麦，主要是澳大利亚小麦，并将其中一些货物提供给其他买家，因为国内供应充足，减少了世界第一大谷物买家的需求。【原文：China has delayed imports of up to 600,000 metric tons of mostly Australian wheat and offered some of these cargoes to other buyers as ample domestic supplies reduce demand in the world's top buyer of the grain, two trade sources with direct knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 世界黄金协会：2024 年黄金需求增长 1%，经济不确定性将继续支撑黄金需求
item.description: 世界黄金协会（WGC）周三表示，随着投资的增加，2024年全球黄金需求（包括场外交易）将增长1%，达到4974.5公吨的历史新高。【原文：Global gold demand including over-the-counter (OTC) trading rose by 1% to a record high of 4,974.5 metric tons in 2024 as investment increased, the World Gold Council (WGC) said on Wednesday, adding that central banks sped up buying in the fourth quarter.】

item.title: 各国齐聚巴黎人工智能峰会，特朗普和 DeepSeek 成为焦点
item.description: 所有人的目光都聚焦在下周的法国首都，看看美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的政府能否与中国和其他近百个国家就人工智能的安全发展找到共同点。【原文：All eyes are on the French capital next week to see if U.S. President Donald Trump’s administration can find common ground with China and nearly 100 other nations on the safe development of artificial intelligence.】

item.title: Equinor 第四季度利润超预期，上调 2030 年石油产量目标
item.description: Equinor 周三公布的 2024 年最后一个季度的利润略高于预期，同时上调了石油和天然气产量预期，并缩减了可再生能源产能扩张计划。【原文：Equinor on Wednesday posted slightly higher-than-expected profits for the final quarter of 2024, while raising its oil and gas output forecast and scaling back plans for renewable energy capacity expansion.】

item.title: 小米创始人为豪华版旗舰电动车设定 1 万辆销量目标
item.description: 小米公司创始人雷军周三在其红米账户上表示，小米旗舰电动车 SU7 Ultra 的豪华版将于 2 月底推出，今年的销售目标是 10,000 台。【原文：The luxury version of Xiaomi's flagship electric vehicle, the SU7 Ultra, will be launched at the end of February, with a sales target of 10,000 units for this year, founder Lei Jun said on his Red Note account on Wednesday.】

item.title: 日本 SKY Perfect JSAT 将投资 2.3 亿美元建造观测卫星
item.description: 日本 SKY Perfect JSAT 公司周三表示，该公司将投资约 2.3 亿美元，利用美国 Planet Labs 公司的鹈鹕卫星建造一个低地轨道卫星星座。【原文：Japan's SKY Perfect JSAT will invest about $230 million to build a constellation of low-Earth orbit satellites using U.S. company Planet Labs' Pelican satellite, the company said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 欧洲 市场对特朗普的加沙建议感到困惑
item.description: 韦恩-科尔对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望。【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Wayne Cole.】

item.title: 丰田将在中国设立全资电动汽车和电池部门
item.description: 全球销量第一的汽车制造商丰田汽车周三表示，将在上海成立一家全资公司，为雷克萨斯品牌开发和生产电动汽车和电池，并将于 2027 年开始生产。【原文：Toyota Motor will establish a wholly owned company in Shanghai to develop and produce electric vehicles and batteries for the Lexus brand, with production set to start in 2027, the world's top-selling automaker said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 丰田将全年利润展望上调 9%，达到近 310 亿美元
item.description: 丰田汽车公司周三将全年营业利润预期上调了 9%，这表明该公司有信心有能力抵御任何潜在的美国关税。【原文：Toyota Motor raised its full-year operating profit forecast by 9% on Wednesday, in a sign of confidence in its ability to ride out any potential U.S. tariffs.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，贝莱德计划在印度增聘 1200 名员工
item.description: 彭博新闻社周二援引知情人士的话报道称，贝莱德计划招聘近 1200 人，以扩大其在印度的两个支持中心。【原文：Blackrock plans to hire nearly 1,200 people to expand its two support hubs in India, Bloomberg News reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 中国钨生产商股价因中国政府最新出口限制措施而上涨
item.description: 在为期一周的农历新年假期结束后的首个交易日，市场对中国政府最新出台的重要矿产出口管制措施做出了反应，中国主要钨生产商的股票在周三反弹。【原文：Shares of major Chinese tungsten producers rallied on Wednesday as markets reacted to Beijing's latest critical mineral export controls on the first day of trading after the week-long Lunar New Year holiday.】

item.title: 备忘录显示，花旗任命 Ashu Khullar 为全球资产管理公司联席主管
item.description: 根据路透社周三看到的一份内部备忘录，花旗集团已任命 Ashu Khullar 与 Anthony Diamandakis 合作，共同担任全球资产管理公司的联席主管。【原文：Citigroup has appointed Ashu Khullar to partner with Anthony Diamandakis to serve together as co-heads of global asset managers, according to an internal memo seen by Reuters on Wednesday.】

item.title: 独家报道东帝汶总统称，在大型天然气项目上，东帝汶倾向于澳大利亚而非中国公司
item.description: 东帝汶总统表示，东帝汶更愿意与澳大利亚以及合作伙伴伍德赛德能源公司（Woodside Energy）和日本大阪燃气公司（Osaka Gas）合作，而不是与表示有兴趣开发停滞不前的大日出天然气田的中国公司合作。【原文：East Timor would prefer to work with Australia and partners Woodside Energy and Japan's Osaka Gas over Chinese firms that have expressed interest in developing the stalled Greater Sunrise natural gas field, its president said.】

item.title: 美国邮政暂停接收来自中国和香港的包裹
item.description: 美国邮政表示，这一变化不会影响来自中国和香港的信件和 "平信 "的流动。美国邮政没有立即评论这是否与特朗普终止从中国和其他国家微量运输的改变有关。【原文：USPS said the change will not impact the flow of letters and 'flats' from China and Hong Kong. It did not immediately comment on whether this was tied to Trump's change to ending de minimis shipments from China and other countries.】

item.title: 市场摆脱中国关税影响，但伊朗压力支撑，石油价格变化不大
item.description: 周三，油价在前一交易日的震荡交投后变化不大，原因是投资者对中国对美国进口能源征收关税的影响避而不谈，尽管唐纳德-特朗普总统再次推动取消伊朗原油出口提供了一些支撑。【原文：Oil prices were little changed on Wednesday after volatile trading in the previous session as investors shrugged off the impact of China's tariffs on U.S. energy imports though President Donald Trump's renewed push to eliminate Iranian crude exports provided some support.】

item.title: 财新PMI显示中国服务业活动增速放缓
item.description: 周三的一项私营部门调查显示，由于春节假期导致就业形势恶化，中国 1 月份服务业活动增速放缓，但企业景气度有所改善。【原文：China's services activity expanded at a slower pace in January, with the Lunar New Year holidays worsening employment, but business sentiment improved, a private sector survey showed on Wednesday.】

item.title: 据塞马福报道，特朗普政府考虑将谢因和特木列入 "强迫劳动 "名单
item.description: 据 Semafor 周二报道，美国正在讨论是否将中国电子商务零售商申银万国和特木网列入国土安全部（DHS）的 "强迫劳动 "名单。【原文：The U.S. is discussing whether to add Chinese ecommerce retailers Shein and Temu to the Department of Homeland Security's (DHS) 'forced labor' list, Semafor reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 特斯拉为中国的 Model 3 购买者提供保险补贴
item.description: 特斯拉中国公司周三在其官方微博上宣布，将为所有 Model 3 购买者提供 8000 元（1103.34 美元）的保险补贴。【原文：Tesla China is offering insurance subsidies of 8,000 yuan ($1,103.34) for all Model 3 buyers, the automaker announced on its official Weibo account on Wednesday.】

item.title: 澳元和新西兰元在中国重新开放前获得喘息机会
item.description: 在中国市场恢复贸易之前，澳元和新西兰元周三继续保持涨势，在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的贸易战爆发之后，中国政府确定了人民币汇率中间价，这成为市场关注的焦点。【原文：The Australian and New Zealand dollars clung to gains on Wednesday ahead of the resumption of trade in Chinese markets, where eyes are on Beijing's fixing of the yuan midpoint rate following the outbreak of Donald Trump's trade war.】

item.title: 日本服务业活动增长得益于亚洲需求，PMI显示
item.description: 周三的一项私营部门调查显示，受亚洲需求带动新出口业务反弹的帮助，日本服务业活动在 1 月份连续第三个月出现扩张。【原文：Japan's service activity expanded for a third straight month in January, helped by a rebound in new export business on Asian demand, a private-sector survey showed on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美联储杰斐逊：利率可能在中期内下降
item.description: 美联储副主席菲利普-杰斐逊（Philip Jefferson）周二表示，美联储至少可以在 "中期内 "继续降息，并重申了美国央行的信息，即决策者不必急于下一次降息。【原文：The Federal Reserve can continue cutting interest rates at least "over the medium term," Fed Vice Chair Philip Jefferson said on Tuesday, reiterating the U.S. central bank's message that policymakers needn't rush their next rate cut.】

item.title: 前谷歌工程师面临新的美国指控，被控为中国公司窃取人工智能机密
item.description: 美国检方周二公布了一份14项罪名的扩大起诉书，指控前谷歌软件工程师丁林伟窃取人工智能商业机密，使他秘密为之工作的两家中国公司受益。【原文：U.S. prosecutors on Tuesday unveiled an expanded 14-count indictment accusing former Google software engineer Linwei Ding of stealing artificial intelligence trade secrets to benefit two Chinese companies he was secretly working for.】

item.title: 西蒙地产季度运营资金超出预期
item.description: 周二，商业地产投资信托公司西蒙地产集团（Simon Property Group）第四季度运营资金超出市场预期，原因是其在美国的商场和高档奥特莱斯的租赁需求保持稳定。【原文：Commercial real estate investment trust Simon Property Group beat market expectations for fourth-quarter funds from operations on Tuesday, as leasing demand remained steady for its U.S. malls and premium outlets.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚 Petro 公司呼吁出售 Ecopetrol 在美国的压裂业务
item.description: 哥伦比亚总统古斯塔沃-彼得罗周二呼吁出售国营石油公司 Ecopetrol 在美国的压裂业务，以投资清洁能源。【原文：Colombian President Gustavo Petro on Tuesday called for the sale of state oil firm Ecopetrol's fracking operations in the United States to invest in clean energy.】

item.title: 财政部称马斯克领导的团队拥有支付数据的只读权限
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的政府效率团队已获准 "只读访问 "美国财政部的支付密码，这是他们正在进行的审查的一部分，目的是 "最大限度地提高支付的完整性"，一位财政部官员在周二写给一位美国民主党高级参议员的信中如是说。【原文：Elon Musk's government-efficiency team has been granted "read-only access" to the U.S. Treasury's payment codes as part of a review they are conducting with the aim to "maximimize payment integrity," a Treasury official wrote in a letter to a senior Democratic U.S. senator on Tuesday.】

item.title: 日本 12 月通胀调整后工资因奖金增加而上涨
item.description: 日本政府周三公布的初步数据显示，得益于冬季奖金的增加，日本 12 月份经通胀调整后的实际工资同比增长了 0.6%，政府官员对未来工资增长势头表示乐观。【原文：Japan's December inflation-adjusted real wages rose 0.6% year-on-year thanks to a wintertime bonus bump, preliminary government data showed on Wednesday, with government officials expressing optimism that wage hike momentum ahead is growing.】

item.title: Enphase 预测第一季度收入高于预期，股价上涨
item.description: 太阳能逆变器制造商恩法斯能源公司（Enphase Energy）周二预计第一季度营收将高于华尔街预期，此前强劲的需求帮助该公司第四季度营业利润好于预期，盘后股价上涨约6%。【原文：Solar inverter maker Enphase Energy forecast first-quarter revenue above Wall Street expectations on Tuesday, after robust demand helped it post a better-than-expected fourth-quarter operating profit, sending its shares up about 6% after the bell.】

item.title: 特拉华州最高法院放宽部分公司离开特拉华州的条件
item.description: 特拉华州最高法院周二发布了一项涉及特里普阿维斯公司的裁决，可能会使一些公司更容易迁出该州，《财富》500 强中约有三分之二的公司都在特拉华州。【原文：The Delaware Supreme Court on Tuesday issued a decision involving TripAdvisor that could make it easier for some companies to move out of the state, which is the corporate home for about two-thirds of the Fortune 500.】
